Annotation.note:
The lines $AL$, $BL$, $CL$ joining the vertices of a triangle $ABC$ to a point $L$ meet the respectively opposite sides in $D$, $E$, $F$. The parallels through $D$ to $BE$, $CF$ meet $AC$, $AB$ in $P$, $Q$, and the parallels through $D$ to $AC$, $AB$ meet $BE$, $CF$ in $R$, $S$. Show that the four points $P$, $Q$, $R$, $S$ are collinear.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
